Abstract: Ann Powers article suggests that culture will be interactive in 21st century, with no lines between artist and appreciator or between individually rendered masterpiece and commonly created work-in-progress (M)
Snippet: Ann Powers article suggests that culture will be interactive in 21st century, with no lines between artist and appreciator or between individually rendered masterpiece and commonly created work-in-progress (M)
LeadParagraph: IMAGINE yourself as a member of an empty orchestra. The music, ever changing within a basic set of themes, wafts forth from instruments held by invisible hands, but the chairs are open for you to occupy and add your part.

Headline.Main: The Artist Formerly Known as Spectator
Headline.PrintHeadline: VISIONS: IDENTITY; The Artist Formerly Known as Spectator
